result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Giovanni Vincent Galdine in court.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Giovanni Vincent Galdine.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Offer received. Asking for 45 days. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

3:25 PM Defendant Giovanni Vincent Galdine in court.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Giovanni Vincent Galdine.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Giovanni Vincent Galdine in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Giovanni Vincent Galdine.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Ozowulu. Argument, denied. Bond remains. Future dates remain as scheduled. Minutes filed.
Motion hearing on September 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Giovanni V Galdine in court, in custody by video. JJ Crawford appeared for the State. Attorney Grace Hagerman appeared for bond purposes only. State is opposing modification of bond. Bond amended to include Pre trial services as a condition. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.

Defendant Giovanni Vincent Galdine in court.  Attorney Jason Daane for Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Giovanni Vincent Galdine.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Still negotiating. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Giovanni Vincent Galdine in court.  Attorney Josh Ryan in court for Giovanni Vincent Galdine. Counsel entered a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. Speedy trial rights reserved. Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

BOND TO COVER 22CM345, 22CM325 & 22CT300

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Giovanni V Galdine in court, in custody by video. Vivien TenHaken for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Josh Polczyski for defendant. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. New total bond set. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
